title: Decision Log Entry
description: Schema for tracking architectural, technical, and process decisions in spec-driven development projects

timestamp.description: ISO 8601 timestamp when the decision was made

decision.description: Concise statement of what was decided

rationale.description: Why this decision was made - context, constraints, trade-offs considered

outcome.description: Expected or actual result of the decision

reversibility.description: Assessment of how easily this decision can be changed

type.description: One-way-door: difficult/costly to reverse. Two-way-door: easily reversible. Partially-reversible: some aspects can be undone.

lock_in_factors.description: Specific factors that create lock-in (e.g., 'vendor contract', 'data migration', 'API exposure', 'team training')

reversal_cost.description: Estimated effort/cost to reverse this decision

reversal_window.description: Time period during which reversal is still feasible (e.g., 'before launch', '30 days', 'indefinite')

implications.description: Downstream effects and dependencies of this decision

affected_components.description: Systems, modules, or components impacted by this decision

dependencies_created.description: New dependencies introduced by this decision

constraints_imposed.description: Limitations or constraints this decision places on future choices

follow_up_decisions.description: Subsequent decisions that must be made as a result

alternatives_considered.description: Other options that were evaluated before this decision

rejected_reason.description: Why this alternative was not chosen

supporting_material.description: External references, documentation, and evidence supporting this decision

internal_refs.description: References to internal project files or documents

related_decisions.description: IDs of related decisions in this log

attachments.description: Paths to attached files (diagrams, benchmarks, etc.)

stakeholders.description: People or roles involved in or affected by this decision

superseded_by.description: Decision ID that replaces this decision (if status is 'superseded')

tags.description: Freeform tags for filtering and grouping decisions

examples.rationale: Need ACID compliance, JSON support, and mature ecosystem. Team has existing expertise.
examples.outcome: All application data will be stored in PostgreSQL with JSONB columns for flexible schemas

reversibility.notes: Switching databases after launch would require significant migration effort

alternatives_considered.rejected_reason: Weaker JSON support, less familiar to team
ACID requirements not met for financial data
